alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 2:07PM PST until January 02 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO NOON PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...High astronomical tides will cause minor flooding in low- lying areas along Humboldt Bay and the northern Humboldt Pacific Coast. High tide is predicted to be around 8.8 feet at North Spit around 1030 AM Saturday morning and tidal anomalies have been running up to one half foot above predicted values. Minor flooding is possible whenever tide levels reach 8.8 feet. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast. * WHEN...From 8 AM to noon PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...King Salmon and Jackson Ranch road in the Arcata Bottoms are the most likely places to observe minor flooding. More significant coastal flooding is possible Monday and Tuesday, accompanied by strong south winds and building surf.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore. Feet Above Ground is locally defined as feet above the Highest Astronomical Tide or HAT.
